etymology.description: Depicts a piece of cloth with two ends hanging down
etymology.interpretation: The character 巾(jīn, "cloth") visually represents a cloth or towel, with its depiction emphasizing the idea of a piece of fabric and its functionality.

examples.chinese: 爸爸用干净的巾擦手(爸爸用乾淨的巾擦手)。
examples.pinyin: Bàba yòng gānjìng de jīn cā shǒu.
examples.english: Dad uses a clean cloth to wipe his hands.

examples.chinese: 她拿着一条巾(她拿著一條巾)，轻轻擦拭眼角(輕輕擦拭眼角)。
examples.pinyin: Tā názhe yì tiáo jīn, qīngqīng cā shì yǎnjiǎo.
examples.english: She holds a cloth and gently wipes the corners of her eyes.

examples.chinese: 老人用巾给手上包扎伤口(老人用巾給手上包扎傷口)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎorén yòng jīn gěi shǒu shàng bāozā shāngkǒu.
examples.english: The elderly person uses a cloth to bandage the wound on his hand.
